subject: Religion & Spirituality
title: Climate Change and Religious Duty
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Climate Change and Religious Duty.

hook.text: 'The Earth is the Lord's.' If you believe that, destroying the climate is a sin. Faith may be the planet's best ally.

buildup.text: Pope Francis's encyclical Laudato Si called climate action a moral obligation. Care for creation is Christian duty.

discovery.text: Islamic, Hindu, and Buddhist leaders have issued similar calls. Stewardship of the Earth is a cross-faith principle.

twist.text: Yet many evangelicals deny climate change, arguing God controls the weather. Same Bible, opposite political conclusions.

climax.text: Climate change is forcing religions to decide: is nature sacred or a resource? The answer shapes policy and behavior.

punchline.text: Is nature sacred or a resource? Climate change forces religions to choose.

quiz.question: What did Pope Francis's Laudato Si call for?
options: Climate action as a moral and religious obligation
